com.viaoa.object
Class OAThreadLocalDelegate

java.lang.Object
  com.viaoa.object.OAThreadLocalDelegate

public class OAThreadLocalDelegate
extends java.lang.Object

Delegate class used to store information about a thread. This is used internally throughout OA to set specific features for a thread. Note: it is important to make sure to call the corresponding reverse value, so that the flags and counters will be unset and the Thread will be removed from internal map.

Author:
vvia

setDataSourceLoadingObject

public static void setDataSourceLoadingObject(boolean b)
Convenience method, used by DataSource when loading OAObjects, so that OAObject.initialize is skipped, no property changes are sent, and object loading flag is set.

Parameters:
b - true if object is being loaded, false when done.

lock

public static void lock(java.lang.Object object,
                        int maxWaitTries)
This locking was created to prevent deadlocks. If a thread is waiting on an object, and the thread already has a lock, then it can be allowed to also have the lock - after waiting a set amount of time. Each Object that is locked keeps track of the threadLocals that are using it. The first threadLocal in the array is the owner. Once it is done (unlocked), it will notify the next threadLocal, etc. Ideally, only one threadLocal at a time will have access to the Object - while the other threads wait. If another thread already has lock(s) on other objects, then it can also be allowed to use the object - after waiting a certain amount of time, and still not given the lock.

Parameters:
maxWaitTries - (default=10) max number of waits (each 25 ms) to wait before taking the lock - 0 to wait until notified. This will only be used if the current threadLocal has 1+ locks already and object is locked by another threadLocal.

lock

public static void lock(java.lang.Object object)
